Definition 7.29. Let X,Z be topological spaces. Then we call f : X → Z well-behaved if for all path-connected open sets U ⊆ Z, f−1(U) has finitely many path-connected components. Definition 7.30 (Mapper). Let f : X → Z be well-behaved, and U be a (finite) open cover of Z. Then the Mapper is defined as M(U,f) := N(f∗(U)).
